channel.title: Fun With Keyboard
channel.description: So I was bored in English. Found out you can pop the keys out. This is what I did. Thinking about making the keys alphabetical instead... [img]http://img815.imageshack.us/img815/9085/0228112232.jpg[/img]

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

In my money management class I would mix all the computer shit up. I would plug a monitor to a computer 3 computers away, I would switch the key board and mouse around.

Read full topic

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:23, topic:384476”][quote author=the wanderer link=topic=480243.msg3516488#msg3516488 date=1299032280]

Wow, funny you should bring this subject up. Someone from our school a few weeks ago was caught popping out keys and messing around with them, ended up having several new rules added just for computers:

1)If you have a D+ or below in a class you are not allowed to use computers.
2)If you MUST use a computer for the class you are failing, you need a written pass from the teacher who teaches that class saying specifically what the computer needs to be used for.

Our school is so fucking strict. These didn’t effect me but in reality our school board thinks we are still in 5th grade.

Further proof that public schools are filled with immature retards.

Wait you calling me immature? I was bored… English bores me.
[/quote]

I’m in Public school, and I didn’t say everyone. Our school gives out a practice SAT test for Freshman, Sophomores and Juniors to take. I’m a freshman, and got a 1570. Yes, that’s a shitty score, but I’m a freshman. However, on a little chart on the side, I scored better then 74% of sophomores. I also hadn’t taken English or Math yet. Again, further proof of how many idiots there are.[/quote]
Hehe, I got a 1970 as a freshman. Sadly, I did horribly on my real SAT’s relative to my score as a freshman. -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

I’m so lost.
Wasn’t the OT about rearranging letters? So much tl;dr.

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:36, topic:384476”]Ah, i misunderstood it, I thought it said $75,000, every year for 4 years, but still pretty amazing like 187 grand a year

Though too bad it cant be spent on other things, but i mean how much Physical Education related things could you buy for 750 grand?

And you did say you had 250 kids at your school?

Anyways, lets stay on topic guys.[/quote]

Basically a few rooms of our school were wiped out and made into one large room. We are going to have a shit load of equipment such as lifting machines and weights put in there. It will also replace our old P.E. equipment, etc. Our school has 250 kids which is why it is kind of funny, but then again it will be open to anyone in our community/close-by, and I am sure with the amount of jocks and sports freaks in our school, it won’t go unused.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:34, topic:384476”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=480243.msg3516595#msg3516595 date=1299036921]
Just read what Parkinson’s Disease is, and its pretty sad that they mess with her like that, (Or to anyone actually)

But she got your school 300 Grand? Dam…

Can you say jewel encrusted toilets?
[/quote]

I wish, but unfortunately is has to be used for anything related to Physical Education. Students are also required to have testing done every so often, such as a pedometer recording log for a week or something…and yeah, 750 grand over the course of 4 years or somewhere around that time.

Teachers like that should teach AP or honors only… saddens me.

100% agree, I have no idea why she is teaching FRESHMAN with her book smarts. Freshman being freshman seem to be the biggest ones on messing with her too, drives me nuts.[/quote]

When I first read this post, I was like,

Testing for pedo----meter… OHH. Nevermind.

I’ve never really messed with anything in my computer classes. None of my classmates are retards.

Read full topic

I wish, but unfortunately is has to be used for anything related to Physical Education. Students are also required to have testing done every so often, such as a pedometer recording log for a week or something…and yeah, 750 grand over the course of 4 years or somewhere around that time.

the wanderer:

Teachers like that should teach AP or honors only… saddens me.

100% agree, I have no idea why she is teaching FRESHMAN with her book smarts. Freshman being freshman seem to be the biggest ones on messing with her too, drives me nuts.

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:32, topic:384476”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=480243.msg3516580#msg3516580 date=1299036128]

I’m in Public school, and I didn’t say everyone. Our school gives out a practice SAT test for Freshman, Sophomores and Juniors to take. I’m a freshman, and got a 1570. Yes, that’s a shitty score, but I’m a freshman. However, on a little chart on the side, I scored better then 74% of sophomores. I also hadn’t taken English or Math yet. Again, further proof of how many idiots there are.

I’m not really sure if it’s intelligence, it’s laziness. I am sure that if the kids in my school weren’t so lazy we would be much higher on the ranks. There is really no reason to be getting below a C in a class. The only way to do that here is not do any homework at all and completely just bomb every test. I can definitely agree with immaturity though.

Lol in computer class, there was this one dude next to me, his name was Nazar, (lol) and so when he left to ask the teacher something, i would hit his keyboard and it would bounce up and down, because the keyboards stands were up, so every day for like 3 weeks i would do that, then one day i hit it so hard, the stands broke, and the space bar stopped working, and half the keyboard, then i thought “I’m on Nazar’s computer, bashin his keyboard” (Lolcats reference)

It was hilarious though, and especially since i never got caught.

We have an English teacher that has Parkinson’s Disease. A lot of people mess around with her by unplugging her mouse, stealing her keys, etc. It was funny but some of the shit they do is ridiculous, which is why I can also follow what reyx7 said about public schools containing a lot of immature retards. Just a few things they do:

-Put onions or some type of food that will rot inside the air vent in her room.
-Hide her car keys so she has to drive the school bus home to get a spare or have her husband pick her up.
-Unplug mouse/keyboard
-Draw genitalia on posters, desks, etc.
-Steal test papers to cheat on them (although most people have gotten caught)

This teacher is a fucking genius in English though, she has high degrees in several English courses and she wrote a pep grant for our school that gives us $750,000 over the course of 4 years or something to build a new workout center for our gigantic school of 250 kids. We have to do a ton of testing for it though and it’s annoying!
[/quote]

Just read what Parkinson’s Disease is, and its pretty sad that they mess with her like that, (Or to anyone actually)

But she got your school 300 Grand? Dam…

Can you say jewel encrusted toilets?[/quote]
750 Grand.

Read full topic

You shoulda unplugged his keyboard. That’s what I did to my friend. He was like “Why the hell isn’t my keyboard working?! Is it broken?!” :’)[/quote]
Ive done that at least 6 times to him rofl

“Hes like wtf why doesnt my keyboard work? Looks at me I bet it was you faggot”

He exits our computer row to go to the back of the computer to check if its plugged in

And i bash his keyboard while he goes lol.

And once i deleted all his browser shortcuts (Mozilla, IE, and Chrome) and he doesnt know shit about comps so hes “WHY CANT I GO ON THE INTERNET”

Those are his exact words.

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:24, topic:384476”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=480243.msg3516492#msg3516492 date=1299032534]
I’m in Public school, and I didn’t say everyone. Our school gives out a practice SAT test for Freshman, Sophomores and Juniors to take. I’m a freshman, and got a 1570. Yes, that’s a shitty score, but I’m a freshman. However, on a little chart on the side, I scored better then 74% of sophomores. I also hadn’t taken English or Math yet. Again, further proof of how many idiots there are.
[/quote]
I cruise through all of my classes and stay at like a b average then when it comes to the last like 2 weeks I try and get it up to an A. School bores me… Wish they taught me something I didn’t know already or was difficult to understand that I wanted to learn. Only thing I can’t seem to understand is genetics… So I sleep/goof off in most of my classes.[/quote]

I’m normally a mix student, with a C, B’s and A’s. This quarter, however, I currently have 3 A’s and a B. the B is like an 83%, idk if I can get 7% in 5 weeks. gah.

Read full topic

Only thing I can’t seem to understand is genetics… So I sleep/goof off in most of my classes.

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

reyx7:

I bet that was a bitch to type then. Ive adapted my own style of typing involving the index and middle finger, sometimes the ring finger, and I can normally do 65 wpm +, 75 is average, 65 with a lot of typos.

i use all my fingers, but my hands are all over the place. its kind of close to how you are suppose to type except i look at the keyboard every now and then.

Read full topic

item.title: Fun With Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

SilentCJ:

I once went round a room and removed the A key from every single keyboard, and placed them all onto one so the only letter to be seen was the letter A, teachers weren’t amused.

This I thought about doing. But sadly the teachers would see me walking around the room going to each computer wondering what I was doing. Also I put the keys in alphabetical order today. Sorry if the picture quality isn’t great. Had to take the picture underneath our computer workstations.

[quote=“xryz, post:11, topic:384476”][quote author=the wanderer link=topic=480243.msg3515818#msg3515818 date=1298979793]

Wouldn’t really matter I don’t look at the keys, as long as they type the same I am fine.

GQE kids are the kids who failed the core 40 and are basically taking middle school classes in high school. So they probably type by chicken pecking.
[/quote]

GQE = graduation qualifying exam… http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=1&sqi=2&ved=0CBQQFjAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.learnmoreindiana.org%2Fcounselors%2Fhighschool%2FAcademicGuidance%2FPages%2FISTEP%2BandGQE.aspx&ei=QkxtTa2DGYnEvQOd9bC-BA&usg=AFQjCNFVemVf4ATOm-cuzxWpLTyXg-ppsQ&sig2=KU5rIpMS6WzgBVi7iEhDpg which means you have to pass that to graduate hs. not you take it if u fail the core 40. the core 40 is a set of standards for a diploma “better” than the standard hs diploma. and core 40 means you take college prep classes as opposed to normal high school classes. which i didnt pass the english part of the gqe the first time by like 4 points, not a surprise since i hate english. i past math by like 200 points. the requirements to pass change every year so if your class(all the students in you grade through the state) is better than you in school the chance is you aren’t going to pass. so ur from indiana? anyways i chicken peck, i just cant type thru the standard way my hands just dont do that. ive had 3 keyboarding classes, and am still not able to type like 70+ gwam. 40 max on a good day.[/quote]
